chapter.title: Adding and Removing Packages and Patches on a Solaris System With Zones Installed (Tasks)

highlights.para: This chapter describes how to add and remove packages and patches on a system with zones installed. Other tasks associated with managing packages and patches, such as checking package parameter settings and obtaining package information, are also addressed. For an overview of patching and packaging concepts on a with zones installed, see Chapter 24, About Packages and Patches on a Solaris System With Zones Installed (Overview).

sect1.title: Adding a Package on a Solaris System With Zones Installed
sect1.para: You can use the pkgadd system utility described in the pkgadd1M man page to perform the following tasks:

listitem.para: Add a package to the global zone only
Add a package to both the global zone and all non-global zones
Add a package that is already installed in the global zone to the non-global zones
Add a package to a specified non-global zone only

sect1.para: The SUNW_PKG_ALLZONES and SUNW_PKG_HOLLOW package parameter settings must match the correct value, either true or false, to add packages. Otherwise, the desired result will not be achieved. For more information about the effect of these package parameter settings, see About Packages and Zones. For more information about how to check these package parameter settings, see Checking Package Parameter Settings on a System with Zones Installed.

task.title: How to Add a Package to the Global Zone Only

tasksummary.para: To add a package to the global zone only, the SUNW_PKG_ALLZONES package parameter must be set to false.
You must be the global administrator in the global zone to perform this procedure.

step.para: Become superuser, or assume the Primary Administrator role.
To create the role and assign the role to a user, see Using the Solaris Management Tools With RBAC (Task Map) in System Administration Guide: Basic Administration.
While in the global zone, run the pkgadd d command followed by the location of the package, the G option, and then the package name.

If installing the package from a directory to which it has been copied, type:
listitem.screen: global# pkgadd d disk1/image G package_name
listitem.para: where disk1 is the location where the package was copied.

note.para: If the pkgadd utility is run without the G option and SUNW_PKG_THISZONE=true, then the specified package is added to the current (global) zone by default.

sect1.title: Checking Package Information on a Solaris System With Zones Installed
sect1.para: You can query the software package database for the global zone and non-global zones by using the pkginfo command. See the pkginfo1 man page for more information about this command.

task.title: How to Check Package Information in the Global Zone Only

step.para: To check the software package database for the global zone only, use pkginfo followed by the package name.

example.title: Using the pkginfo Command in the Global Zone
example.screen: global% pkginfo SUNWcsr SUNWcsu system SUNWcsr Core Solaris, (Root) system SUNWcsu Core Solaris, (Usr)

task.title: How to Check Package Information in a Specified Non-Global Zone Only

step.para: To check the software package database in a specific non-global zone, log into the non-global zone and use pkginfo followed by the package name.

example.title: Using the pkginfo Command in a Non-Global Zone
example.screen: my-zone% pkginfo SUNWcsr SUNWcsu system SUNWcsr Core Solaris, (Root) system SUNWcsu Core Solaris, (Usr)

sect1.title: Removing a Package From a Solaris System With Zones Installed
sect1.para: You can use the pkgrm system utility described in the pkgrm1M man page to perform the following tasks:

listitem.para: Remove a package from the global zone and all non-global zones
Remove a package from a specified non-global zone only

sect1.para: The SUNW_PKG_ALLZONES and SUNW_PKG_HOLLOW package parameter settings must match the correct value, either true or false, to remove packages. Otherwise, the desired result will not be achieved. For more information about the effect of these package parameter settings, see About Packages and Zones. For more information about how to check these package parameter settings, see Checking Package Parameter Settings on a System with Zones Installed.

task.title: How to Remove a Package From the Global Zone and All Non-Global Zones

tasksummary.para: You must be the global administrator in the global zone to perform this procedure.

step.para: Become superuser, or assume the Primary Administrator role.
To create the role and assign the role to a user, see Using the Solaris Management Tools With RBAC (Task Map) in System Administration Guide: Basic Administration.
While in the global zone, run the pkgrm command followed by the package name.

task.title: How to Remove a Package From a Specified Non-Global Zone Only

tasksummary.para: To remove a package from a specified non-global zone only, the SUNW_PKG_ALLZONES package parameter must be set to false.
You must be the zone administrator in the non-global zone to perform this procedure.

step.para: Log in to the non-global zone as the zone administrator.
While in the non-global zone, my-zone in this procedure, run the pkgrm command followed by the package name.

sect1.title: Applying a Patch to a Solaris System With Zones Installed
sect1.para: You can use the patchadd system utility described in the patchadd1M man page to perform the following tasks:

listitem.para: Apply a patch to the global zone only
Apply a patch to the global zone and all non-global zones
Apply a patch to specified non-global zone only

task.title: How to Apply a Patch to the Global Zone Only

tasksummary.para: You must be the global administrator in the global zone to perform this procedure.

step.para: Become superuser, or assume the Primary Administrator role.
To create the role and assign the role to a user, see Using the Solaris Management Tools With RBAC (Task Map) in System Administration Guide: Basic Administration.
Execute the patchadd command with the Goption, followed by the patch ID.

task.title: How to Apply a Patch to the Global Zone and All Non-Global Zones

tasksummary.para: You must be the global administrator in the global zone to perform this procedure.

step.para: Become superuser, or assume the Primary Administrator role.
To create the role and assign the role to a user, see Using the Solaris Management Tools With RBAC (Task Map) in System Administration Guide: Basic Administration.
Execute the patchadd command followed by the patch ID.

task.title: How to Apply a Patch to a Specified Non-Global Zone Only

tasksummary.para: To apply a patch to a specified non-global zone only, the SUNW_PKG_ALLZONES package parameter for all packages in the patch set must be set to false.
You must be the zone administrator in the non-global zone to perform this procedure.

step.para: Log in to the non-global zone as the zone administrator.
While in the non-global zone, my-zone in this procedure, execute the patchadd command followed by the patch ID.

sect1.title: Removing a Patch on a System with Zones Installed
sect1.para: You can use the patchrm system utility described in the patchrm1M man page to perform the following task:

listitem.para: Remove a patch from the global zone and all non-global zones
Remove a patch from a specified non-global zone only

task.title: How to Remove a Patch From the Global Zone and All Non-Global Zones

task.title: How to Remove a Patch From a Specified Non-Global Zone Only

tasksummary.para: To remove a patch from a specified non-global zone only, the SUNW_PKG_ALLZONES package parameter for all packages in the patch set must be set to false.
You must be the zone administrator in the non-global zone to perform this procedure.

step.para: Log in to the non-global zone as the zone administrator.
While in the non-global zone, my-zone in this procedure, execute the patchrm command followed by the patch ID.

sect1.title: Checking Package Parameter Settings on a System with Zones Installed
sect1.para: Before you add or remove a software package, you can use the pkgparam command to check package parameter settings. This step is optional. This check also can be done when troubleshooting why a package is not added or removed as expected. For information about displaying package parameter values, see the pkgparam1 man page.

task.title: (Optional) How to Check the Setting of a Package Already Installed on the System

step.para: To check the package parameter setting of a package that is already installed in a global or non-global zone, use pkgparam followed by the package name and the name of the parameter.
step.screen: my-zone% pkgparam package_name SUNW_PKG_ALLZONES true my-zone% pkgparam package_name SUNW_PKG_HOLLOW false

task.title: (Optional) How to Check the Setting of a Package in Software on a CD-ROM

step.para: To check the package parameter setting of an uninstalled package in software located on a CD-ROM, use pkgparam d with the path of the CD-ROM followed by the package name and the name of the parameter.
step.screen: my-zone% pkgparam d /cdrom/cdrom0/directory package_name SUNW_PKG_ALLZONES true my-zone% pkgparam d /cdrom/cdrom0/directory package_name SUNW_PKG_HOLLOW false
